document.docAuthor: Pešić, Vladimir, Cook, David, Gerecke, Reinhard & Smit, Harry
document.docTitle: Djeboa amendano Pesic, Cook & Gerecke, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The water mite family Mideopsidae (Acari: Hydrachnidia): a contribution to the diversity in the Afrotropical region and taxonomic changes above species level

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The water mite family Mideopsidae (Acari: Hydrachnidia): a contribution to the diversity in the Afrotropical region and taxonomic changes above species level

subSubSection.paragraph:

Sphagnum

22 .iv. 2011

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2A–F.
Djeboa amendano
sp. nov. (B = male, A, C–F = female): A = dorsal shield; B–C = idiosoma, ventral view; D = palp; E = I-L; F = IV-L.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology : Named after river where it was collected.

Discussion :
Djeboa amendano
sp. nov. is characterized by a dorsal shield without a medial depression, and muscle scars visible only as a lightly whitish areas. It is similar to
Djeboa curtipalpis
sp. nov. from Ghana (see the latter for further discussion).
